actions.text: Referred to House Committee on International Relations.
Committee on International Relations discharged in House.
Referred to Senate Committee on Foreign Relations.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Foreign Relations, S. Rept. 95-773.

official_title: A resolution praising the United States delegation to the Belgrade meeting of the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe for its efforts on behalf of human rights, and urging the President to continue to express United States opposition to repressive actions and to violations of basic human rights which are contrary to the Helsinki Accords.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues
subjects_top_term: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Commends the United States delegation to the Belgrade Conference for obtaining a review of compliance with the human rights provisions of the Helsinki Accords (the Final Act of the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe). Urges the President and other executive branch officials to continue to express United States opposition to repressive actions and violations of human rights which are contrary to the Helsinki Accords.

titles.title: A resolution praising the United States delegation to the Belgrade meeting of the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe for its efforts on behalf of human rights, and urging the President to continue to express United States opposition to repressive actions and to violations of basic human rights which are contrary to the Helsinki Accords.
